commit.message: codacy changes, delete commented code, change to dockstore-testing repo

nodes.bodyText: This is not necessary -- doing the addAll on line 377 will work with an empty set.
Hmm, there could be other registries that we don't know about or don't yet exist. Without knowing the format, is there a distinct pattern you could check for to see if it's DockerHub?
Comment for line 346 -- you can remove DockerHub from the TODO

nodes.bodyText: You may not be able to do this in an interface (I don't know if it's allowed), but if possible these would exist as final statics outside of the method, so that you the regexes aren't complied every time the method is invoked. But if it's not easily doable, then don't worry.
Do you need this commented line?
Redundant
Redundant
does "CWL" work? If it does, change to that or use an enum to string
Docker Hub

Might be worth a constraint.
i.e. DB only allows the same tag and imageRegistry multiple times if architecture is unique
Can be re-used

Would be more readable using swagger-java-quay-client.
Can take a look at the series of PRs ending with #3273 to demo how to use it.

commit.message: hope this is somewhat more readable
fixing swagger easier than I thought it'd be

nodes.bodyText: This line doesn't do anything, does it? You're ignoring the return value.
Can tag be null? If yes, you need a check here.
If os and osVersion are empty strings, you'll end up with / as the OS. Do you want that (I don't know)?

Just a small style thing, but on the previous line you go to the trouble of setting registryFound to null, but then you don't check against it; you check against registry, so that if statement checks against two different variables for sort of the same value.
Double double slashes :)
Consider putting this into dockstore-testing
Changing on purpose?
Sorry, I think this is wrong; registry will never be null. I meant have registryFound == null, so that you're using the same variable throughout the if statement. Sorry for the confusion.
